meanings.definition: Making sharp snapping or popping sounds
meanings.sent1: The campfire made a crackly noise as the wood burned.
meanings.sent2: The leaves under my feet were dry and crackly.
meanings.sent3: The crackly sound of the chips being eaten was oddly satisfying.
meanings.sent4: Her voice was like a crackly vinyl record, full of pops and snaps.
meanings.sent5: The crackly sound of the old radio filled the room with nostalgia.

meanings.definition: Having a surface that makes crackling noises when touched
meanings.sent1: The crackly leaves crunched under my boots.
meanings.sent2: The crackly texture of the burnt toast was not appetizing.
meanings.sent3: The crackly paper bag sounded like a symphony when crumpled.
meanings.sent4: Her crackly hair felt like straw to the touch.
meanings.sent5: The crackly surface of the ice made it dangerous to walk on.

meanings.definition: A sound that is sharp and popping in nature
meanings.sent1: The crackly of the fireworks filled the night sky.
meanings.sent2: The crackly of the popcorn in the microwave signaled it was ready.
meanings.sent3: The crackly of the bubble wrap being popped was music to his ears.
meanings.sent4: The crackly of the old record player brought back memories of childhood.
meanings.sent5: The crackly of the bonfire was accompanied by laughter and chatter.
